result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned from 5712 W State Hwy 33, Portage marked "Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward."
Copy of Letter from ADA Crystal Long to Atty Karpe        re:  Discovery.

Cases called: 14CF393, 15CF220 & 15CF438, Defendant Luke James Blackley in court with attorney David Karpe. Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Court explained read in and dismissed to the defendant. Defendant pled guilty to count 2 in 15CF220.  Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, ordered a PSI to be done. Count 1 read in and dismissed. 14CF393 & 15CF438 read in and dismissed. Argued sentencing to be set once PSI received.
And Specific Demand for Items of Discovery filed by Atty. Karpe

April 20, 2016 motion to suppress hearing filed by Court Reporter Chris Champeau
ADA Long discovery letter to Atty. Karpe
#1  Portage PD Case Notes

Defendant Luke James Blackley in court with attorney David Karpe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Only 14CF393 called, and being addressed today.  Court took recess to allow State to read through the Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statement.  Court resumed.  No agreement between State and Defense on suppression of statements made after Miranda.  State and Defense agree statements prior to Miranda can not be used.  State called Det. Robert Bagnall.  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Exhibit #1 ( dispatch record of Portage P.D.).  Marked.  Received.  Redirect.  Witness excused.  Argument by State and Defense.  Court found Det. had reason to search defendant.  Motion to suppress is denied.  10:18/11:05
Motion hearing at 04-20-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Luke James Blackley in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Attorney Mark D. Lawton appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant refused to come with law enforcement from jail.  Requested anther prelim.  Court advised atty Lawton to talk with Br. 3 to see how they would like to proceed.
